item.title: Bwm-ng: Measure Bandwidth Consumption in Real Time
item.description:
Introduction link

Sometimes, you need to measure the current total bandwidth. bwm-ng is your friend :-)

Installation link

On Debian, it’s easy:

 apt-get install bwm-ng

Usage link

Simply run the command to get it working directly:

 $ bwm-ng
 bwm-ng v0.6 (probing every 0.500s), press 'h' for help
 input: /proc/net/dev type: rate
 | iface Rx Tx Total
 ==============================================================================
 lo: 0.00 KB/s 0.00 KB/s 0.00 KB/s
 eth0: 2275.89 KB/s 57.56 KB/s 2333.45 KB/s
 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 total: 2275.89 KB/s 57.56 KB/s 2333.45 KB/s

item.title: QoS (Quality Of Service) with PF
item.description:
Introduction link

Hierarchical Fair Service Curve (HFSC) alias QOS: Quality of Service (QoS) is an attempt to give priority to a packet type or data connection on a per session basis. Hierarchical Fair Service Curve takes QoS to the next level over CBQ by focusing on guaranteed real-time, adaptive best-effort, and hierarchical link-sharing service.

Though this may sound difficult, it is really easy to use once you understand the basics.
